MOLECULAR PHARMACOLOGY, 47:1126-1132 (1996).
Production and Characterization of Multiple Antigenic Peptide
Antibodies to the Adenosine A2b Receptor
NIKOLA K. PUFFINBARGER, KARL R. HANSEN, REGINA RESTA, ALETHA B. LAURENT, THOMAS B. KNUDSEN,
JAMES L. MADARA, and LINDA F. THOMPSON
Immunobiology and Cancer Program, Oklahoma Medical Research Foundation, Oklahoma City, Okiahoma 73104 (N.K.P., K.R.H., R.R., A.B.L,
L.F.T.J), Department of Medicine, Oklahoma University Health Sciences Center, Oklahoma City, Okiahoma 73104 (R.R.), Department of
Pathology. Anatomy, and Cell Biology, Jefferson Medical College, Philadeiphia, Pennsytvania 19107-5799 (T.B.K.), and Division of
Gastrointestinal Pathology, Brigham and Women's Hospital, Boston, Massachusetts 02115 (J.L.M.)
Received January 6, 1995; Accepted March 24, 1995

A polyclonal antibody to the human adenosine A receptor
(AR) was produced by immunizing a chicken with a multiple
formalin-fixed tissue sections. In human colon, the AR was
